titles.title: Prompt Compensation Act of 2002
To amend the Act popularly known as the Declaration of Taking Act to require that all condemnations of property by the Government proceed under that Act.

bill.summary: 5/20/2002--Introduced. Prompt Compensation Act of 2002 - Amends the Declaration of Taking Act to require (current law authorizes): (1) the petitioner in a proceeding instituted in a U.S. court outside of the District of Columbia for the acquisition of land for public use, to file within 90 days after filing the petition (currently, at any time before judgment) a declaration that such lands are thereby taken; (2) the petitioner, upon filing such declaration, to deposit with the court the amount estimated by the acquiring authority to be just compensation for the land taken; and (3) the court, upon application of the parties in interest, to order that such compensation be awarded.
